info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 1:49PM MDT until July 01 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CHAFFEE COUNTY... At 149 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain has moved away from the Poncha Pass area. However. additional thunderstorms were noted in western Chaffee county and these storms may move over the Poncha Pass area this afternoon. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rock and mudslides will be possible over highway 285 in the Poncha Pass region. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Poncha Springs and Poncha Pass. This includes the following high risk locations... Highway 285 south of Poncha Springs to Poncha Pass. This includes the following streams and drainages... San Luis Creek, Green Creek, Silver Creek, North Fork South Arkansas River, Droz Creek, Little Cochetopa Creek, Redman Creek, South Arkansas River, Arkansas River, Stumpy Creek, Poncha Creek, Pass Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
